Key Match Events: Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell led New Zealand to an 8-wicket victory against Bangladesh.
Lockie Ferguson clinched 3 wickets, Trent Boult and Matt Henry got two wickets each while Glenn Phillips and Mitchell Santner have one wicket each.
Shakib Al Hasan dismissed Devon Conway, ending a strong partnership.
Mustafizur Rahman dismissed opener Rachin Ravindra early in New Zealand's run chase.
Mahmudullah provided Bangladesh with crucial runs, scoring 41.
Lockie Ferguson was named Player of the Match for his spell of 3/49.
Daryl Mitchell finished the innings with a stylish SIX against Shoriful Islam.
Kane Williamson retired hurt due to a hand injury but scored 78 runs.
Daryl Mitchell scored 89 not out, contributing significantly to the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand maintained their dominance in the ICC World Cup 2023 with their third consecutive win.
Bangladesh was restricted to 245/9 after 50 overs.
New Zealand's bowlers, including Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult, and Matt Henry, played a crucial role in restricting Bangladesh.
